author: Stuart Rogers
title: Luxury river cruises: amazing voyages around the world
text: With fully inclusive pricing and luxurious ships, the joys of river cruising can be savoured all over the world. Take a look at these four APT options for inspiration for your next trip... Majestic Burma One of the world’s least explored destinations, Burma (Myanmar) is an extraordinarily beautiful land that has been left untouched by visitors for an entire generation. Imperial wonder: discover the beauty of Burma This premium 17-day Majestic Burma river cruise takes you along the Irrawaddy River from Yangon to Mandalay aboard RV Princess Panhwar, a new boutique river ship with 36 suites, each featuring a French or outside balcony. Along the way, you will be entranced by gilded temples and pagodas, lush landscapes and age-old traditions. You’ll be completely immersed in the local way of life and be given the opportunity to discover wonderfully remote and otherwise inaccessible places Guided sightseeing includes a visit to Mandalay’s Mahamuni Buddha Temple, where you could add your own sheet of gold leaf to a statue of the Buddha; a visit to the mighty Shwedagon Pagoda and the Reclining Buddha in Yangon; a walking tour of spectacular Maubin and visit to a traditional market; a visit to learn about the history of Minhla fort; a tour of Inwa by horse-drawn cart; and a stroll along the UBein Bridge near Amarapura – all at no extra cost. This 17-day premium Majestic Burma river cruise costs from £3,995pp, twin share, including an early booking saving of £500 per couple when booked by 31 October 2015. Departures from January 2016 to March 2017. Find out more » Spirit of India This 17-day river cruise and tour visits India’s great landmarks. With luxurious accommodation throughout, it takes you from Delhi to Agra’s Red Fort and includes a night at the Oberoi Amarvilas with guaranteed views of the Taj Mahal. After an elephant safari near the “Pink City” of Jaipur, you’ll fly to Kolkata and embark on a seven-night Lower Ganges cruise on the luxurious RV Ganges Voyager, an all-suite ship taking just 56 guests. You’ll be completely immersed in the local way of life and be given the opportunity to discover a wonderfully remote and otherwise inaccessible corner of West Bengal. Excursions, all at no extra cost, include a cooking demonstration in a Delhi family’s home; a ride aboard a private tramcar to learn about Kolkata’s heritage; a visit to Howrah Bridge and the Mullik Ghat Flower Market. APT’s 17-day luxury Spirit of India river cruise and tour costs from £7,595pp, twin share. Book by 31 October, 2015 and your companion flies free. Departures from January to November 2016. Find out more » Indian adventure: explore the country's most famous sights by river Best of China On APT’s Best of China river cruise and tour you will be escorted around Beijing, Xi’an and Shanghai and enjoy a four-night cruise on the Yangtze River. Your trip begins with a three-night stay at Raffles Beijing where you’ll enjoy a private cruise around the Summer Palace and tour of Tiananmen Square and the Forbidden City. Freedom of Choice options include a Peking Opera show, Kung Fu Show or trip to Silk Alley market. At the Great Wall of China, you’ll wander along a rarely visited stretch of the Badaling section and enjoy a private buffet lunch. After a flight to Yichang, you’ll join the luxurious Sanctuary Yangzi Explorer for a four-night Yangtze river cruise through the Three Gorges. Arriving in Chongqing, you’ll see giant pandas at the zoo before flying to Xi’an to view the Terracotta Army from an exclusive platform. The tour ends with a three-night stay at the Fairmont Peace Hotel in Shanghai where you will enjoy premium seating at an acrobatic show and Freedom of Choice activities include a Shanghai Dumpling cooking class, or a traditional Chinese tea ceremony at Yu Garden. APT’s 14-day Best of China luxury river cruise and tour costs from £3,945pp, twin share. Book by 31 October 2015 and your companion flies free. Departures from March to November 2016. Find out more » Majestic Mississippi The Majestic Mississippi river cruise and tour takes you from New Orleans to Memphis on a modern paddle-wheeler. Spending two nights at The Roosevelt New Orleans, you’ll be led from your hotel to the French Quarter by a Dixieland Jazz marching band in your very own secondline parade. And you’ll get an insider’s look at the Mardi Gras preparations before setting off on your Mississippi cruise. Southern charm: take a musical tour from New Orleans to Memphis Highlights include an afterhours tour of Graceland – the former home of Elvis Presley – and dinner in the Elvis Presley Automobile Museum; a backstage tour of the Grand Ole Opry House, the home of country music; and, during a two-night stay in Nashville, dinner at the Country Music Hall of Fame with a private musical performance by a relative of Johnny Cash. APT’s 14-day luxury river cruise and tour costs from £6,995pp, twin share. Book by 31 October 2015 and your companion flies free. Departures from April to September 2016. Find out more »
